intro: Chaubardia surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that attract pollinators. Its botanical features make it a notable species in horticulture and ecological studies.
